info.title: Dynatrace Configuration API
info.description:
Documentation of the Dynatrace Configuration API. To read about use-cases and examples, see [Dynatrace Documentation](https://dt-url.net/4u43kxw).

Notes about compatibility:
* Operations marked as early adopter or preview may be changed in non-compatible ways, although we try to avoid this.
* We may add new enum constants without incrementing the API version; thus, clients need to handle unknown enum constants gracefully.

get.summary: Lists all alerting profiles available in your environment

post.summary: Creates a new alerting profile
post.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains parameters of the new alerting profile.

201.description: Success. The new alerting profile has been created. The response contains the ID of the new alerting profile.

get.summary: Gets the properties of the specified alerting profile

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the required alerting profile.

put.summary: Updates an existing alerting profile
put.description: If an alerting profile with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new one is created.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the alerting profile to be updated.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains updated parameters of the alerting profile.

204.description: Success. The alerting profile has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

201.description: Success. The new alerting profile has been created. The response contains the ID of the new alerting profile.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified alerting profile
delete.description: The default alerting profile cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the alerting profile to be deleted.

204.description: Success. The alerting profile has been deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

post.summary: Validates the payload the `POST /alertingProfiles` request

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains parameters of the alerting profile to be validated.

204.description: Validated. The submitted alerting profile is valid. Response doesn't have a body

post.summary: Validates the payload the `PUT /alertingProfiles/{id}` request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the alerting profile to be validated.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains parameters of the alerting profile to be validated.

204.description: Validated. The submitted alerting profile is valid. Response doesn't have a body

get.summary: Lists all existing disk event rules | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

post.summary: Creates a new disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER
post.description: The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the request. Contains parameters of the new disk event rule.

201.description: Success. The new disk event rule has been created. The ID of the new disk event rule is returned.

get.summary: Gets the properties of the specified disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the required disk event rule.

put.summary: Updates or creates a disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER
put.description: If a disk event rule with the specified ID does not exist, a new rule is created.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the disk event rule to be updated.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the request. Contains updated disk event rule parameters.

201.description: Success. The new disk event rule has been created. The ID of the new disk event rule is returned.

204.description: Success. The disk event rule has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

403.description: Failed. The specified ID is reserved for internal use.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified disk event rule | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the disk event rule to be deleted.

204.description: Success. The disk event rule has been deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

post.summary: Validates the payload for the `POST /anomalyDetection/diskEvents` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

requestBody.description: JSON body of the request. Contains the disk event rule to be validated.

204.description: Validated. The submitted disk event rule is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

post.summary: Validates the payload for the `PUT /anomalyDetection/diskEvents/{id}` request | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the disk event rule to be validated.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the request. Contains the disk event rule to be validated.

204.description: Validated. The submitted disk event rule is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

403.description: Failed. The specified ID is reserved for internal use.

204.description: Success. Configuration has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

get.summary: Lists all configured metric events

parameters.name: includeEntityFilterMetricEvents
parameters.description:
Flag to include metric events with associated entities to the response. 

 Metric events with **entity** filters aren't compatible across environments. If set to `false`, metric events with entity filters will be removed.

post.summary: Creates a new metric event
post.description: The response contains the ID of the newly created metric event.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains parameters of the new metric event.

201.description: Success. The metric event has been created. The response contains the ID and name of the newly created metric event

get.summary: Gets the properties of the specified metric event

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the required metric event.

put.summary: Updates an existing metric event or creates a new one
put.description:
If the metric event with the specified ID does not exist, a new metric event will be created. 

 You can't update the **type** of the metric event.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The ID of the metric event to be updated.

 If you also set the ID in the body, it must match this ID.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains updated parameters of the metric event.

201.description: Success. The new metric event has been created. The response contains the ID of the newly created metric event

204.description: Success. The metric event has been updated. The response is empty.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified metric event
delete.description: You can't delete events created by plugins.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the metric event to be deleted.

204.description: Deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

post.summary: Validates the payload for the `POST /anomalyDetection/metricEvents` request

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains the metric event configuration to validate.

204.description: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

post.summary: Validates the payload for the `PUT /anomalyDetection/metricEvents/{id}` request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the metric event to be validated.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains the metric event configuration to validate.

204.description: Validated. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains anomaly detection configuration to be validated.

tags: RUM - Mobile and custom application configuration
get.summary: Lists all existing mobile and custom applications

tags: RUM - Mobile and custom application configuration
post.summary: Creates a new mobile or custom application
post.description:
The body must not provide an identifier. An identifier is assigned automatically by Dynatrace. 

You can, however, provide your own applicationId. If you don't specify an applicationId, it is assigned automatically by Dynatrace.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains the parameters of the new mobile or custom application.

201.description: Success. The application has been created. The response contains the identifier and name of the new application.

409.description: Failed. The applicationId is already used by another application.

tags: RUM - Mobile and custom application configuration
get.summary: Gets the configuration of the specified mobile or custom application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the required mobile or custom application.

404.description: Failed. The specified entity doesn't exist.

tags: RUM - Mobile and custom application configuration
put.summary: Updates the configuration of the specified mobile or custom application
put.description:
You can't change applicationId and applicationType with this request.

All other values must be included in the body, depending on the applicationType.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application to be updated.

requestBody.description:
The JSON body of the request. Contains updated configuration of the mobile or custom application. 

Do not set the identifier in the body.

204.description: Success. The application has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

404.description: Failed. The specified entity doesn't exist.

tags: RUM - Mobile and custom application configuration
delete.summary: Deletes the specified mobile or custom application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application to be deleted.

204.description: Success. The application has been deleted. The response doesn't have a body.

404.description: Failed. The specified entity doesn't exist.

tags: RUM - Mobile and custom application configuration
post.summary: Validates the payload for the `POST /applications/mobile` request

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains the mobile or custom application configuration to be validated.

204.description: Success. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

tags: RUM - Mobile and custom application configuration
post.summary: Validates the payload for the `PUT /applications/mobile/{id}` request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the mobile or custom application to be validated.

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains the mobile or custom application configuration to be validated.

204.description: Success. The submitted configuration is valid. Response doesn't have a body.

get.summary: Gets the configuration of the default web application
get.description:
Default application is pre-configured in your Dynatrace environment. By default all traffic goes to this application. 

After you configure your own applications, all the traffic, which doesn't fit to any of your applications, goes to the default one.

put.summary: Updates the configuration of the default web application
put.description:
Default application is pre-configured in your Dynatrace environment. By default all traffic goes to this application. 

After you configure your own applications, all the traffic, which doesn't fit to any of your applications, goes to the default one.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the request, containing the new parameters of the default web application.

204.description: Success. Configuration has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

get.summary: Lists all existing web applications

post.summary: Creates a new web application
post.description: The body must not provide an ID as that will be automatically assigned by Dynatrace server.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the request, containing parameters of the new web application configuraiton.

201.description: Success. The response body contains the ID and name of the new web application.

delete.summary: Removes the specified user action from the list of key user actions in the specified web application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the required web application.

parameters.name: keyUserActionId
parameters.description: The ID of the user action to be removed from the key user actions list.

204.description: Success. The user action has been removed from the list of key user actions. The response doesn't have a body.

get.summary: Gets the configuration of the specified web application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the requested web application.

put.summary: Updates the configuration of the specified web application or creates a new one
put.description: If the application with the specified ID does not exist, a new application will be created.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The ID of the web application to update. 

If you set the ID in the body as well, it must match this ID.

requestBody.description: JSON body of the request, containing updated configuration of the web application.

201.description: Success. The new configuration has been created. The response body contains the ID and name of the new web application.

204.description: Success. Configuration has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified web application

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the web application to delete.

204.description: Success. The application has been deleted. The response does not have a body.

After you configure your own applications, all the traffic, which doesn't fit to any of your applications, goes to the default one.

get.summary: Lists all available application detection rules

post.summary: Creates a new application detection rule
post.description:
The body must not provide an ID. An ID is assigned automatically by the Dynatrace server. 

You can only create detection rules for an existing application. If you need to create a rule for an application that doesn't exist yet, [create an application first](https://dt-url.net/vt03khh) and then configure detection rules for it.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
The position of the new rule: 

 * `APPEND`: at the bottom of the rule list. 
 * `PREPEND`: at the top of the rule list.

If the **order** parameter is set for an existing rule, the request uses this value. Otherwise it keeps the existing order of rules.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:

requestBody.description:

AlertingCustomEventFilter.description:
Configuration of a custom event filter. 

Filters custom events by title or description. If both specified, the AND logic applies.

enabled.description: The filter is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

operator.description:
Operator of the comparison. 

 You can reverse it by setting **negate** to `true`.

negate.description: Reverses the comparison **operator**. For example it turns the **begins with** into **does not begin with**.

caseInsensitive.description:
The condition is case sensitive (`false`) or case insensitive (`true`). 

 If not set, then `false` is used, making the condition case sensitive.

AlertingEventTypeFilter.description:
Configuration of the event filter for the alerting profile. 

You have two mutually exclusive options: 
* Select an event type from the list of the predefined events. Specify it in the **predefinedEventFilter** field. 
* Set a rule for custom events. Specify it in the **customEventFilter** field.

eventType.description: The type of the predefined event.

negate.description:
The alert triggers when the problem of specified severity arises while the specified event **is** happening (`false`) or while the specified event is **not** happening (`true`). 

 For example, if you chose the Slowdown (`PERFORMANCE`) severity and Unexpected high traffic (`APPLICATION_UNEXPECTED_HIGH_LOAD`) event with **negate** set to `true`, the alerting profile will trigger only when the slowdown problem is raised while there is no unexpected high traffic event. 

Consider the following use case as an example. The Slowdown (`PERFORMANCE`) severity rule is set. Depending on the configuration of the event filter (Unexpected high traffic (`APPLICATION_UNEXPECTED_HIGH_LOAD`) event is used as an example), the behavior of the alerting profile is one of the following:* **negate** is set to `false`: The alert triggers when the slowdown problem is raised while unexpected high traffic event is happening. 
* **negate** is set to `true`: The alert triggers when the slowdown problem is raised while there is no unexpected high traffic event. 

* no event rule is set: The alert triggers when the slowdown problem is raised, regardless of any events.

AlertingPredefinedEventFilter.description: Configuration of a predefined event filter.

id.description: The ID of the alerting profile.

displayName.description: The name of the alerting profile, displayed in the UI.

rules.description:
A list of severity rules. 

 The rules are evaluated from top to bottom. The first matching rule applies and further evaluation stops.

 If you specify both severity rule and event filter, the AND logic applies.

mzId.description: The ID of the management zone to which the alerting profile applies.

eventTypeFilters.description:
The list of event filters. 

For all filters that are *negated* inside of these event filters, that is all "Predefined" as well as "Custom" (Title and/or Description) ones the AND logic applies.
For all *non-negated* ones the OR logic applies.
Between these two groups, negated and non-negated, the AND logic applies.

 If you specify both severity rule and event filter, the AND logic applies.

severityLevel.description: The severity level to trigger the alert.

delayInMinutes.description: Send a notification if a problem remains open longer than *X* minutes.

AlertingProfileSeverityRule.description:
A severity rule of the alerting profile. 

 A severity rule defines the level of severity that must be met before an alert is sent our for a detected problem. Additionally it restricts the alerting to certain monitored entities.

includeMode.description:
The filtering mode: 
* `INCLUDE_ANY`: The rule applies to monitored entities that have at least one of the specified tags. You can specify up to 100 tags. 
* `INCLUDE_ALL`: The rule applies to monitored entities that have **all** of the specified tags. You can specify up to 10 tags. 
* `NONE`: The rule applies to all monitored entities.

AlertingProfileTagFilter.description: Configuration of the tag filtering of the alerting profile.

currentConfigurationVersions.description: A sorted list of version numbers of the configuration.

configurationVersions.description: A sorted list of the version numbers of the configuration.

context.description:
The origin of the tag, such as AWS or Cloud Foundry. 

Custom tags use the `CONTEXTLESS` value.

key.description:
The key of the tag. 

Custom tags have the tag value here.

value.description:
The value of the tag. 

 Not applicable to custom tags.

TagFilter.description: A tag-based filter of monitored entities.

values.description: An ordered list of short representations of Dynatrace entities.

StubList.description: An ordered list of short representations of Dynatrace entities.

failingServiceCallPercentageIncreaseAbso.description: Absolute increase of failing service calls to trigger an alert, %.

failingServiceCallPercentageIncreaseRela.description: Relative increase of failing service calls to trigger an alert, %.

FailureRateIncreaseAutodetectionConfig.description:
Parameters of failure rate increase auto-detection. Required if **detectionMode** is `DETECT_AUTOMATICALLY`. Not applicable otherwise. 

The absolute and relative thresholds **both** must exceed to trigger an alert. 

Example: If the expected error rate is 1.5%, and you set an absolute increase of 1%, and a relative increase of 50%, the thresholds will be: 
Absolute: 1.5% + **1%** = 2.5% 
Relative: 1.5% + 1.5% * **50%** = 2.25%

detectionMode.description: How to detect failure rate increase: automatically, or based on fixed thresholds, or do not detect.

FailureRateIncreaseDetectionConfig.description: Configuration of failure rate increase detection.

threshold.description: Failure rate during any 5-minute period to trigger an alert, %.

sensitivity.description:
Sensitivity of the threshold. 

With `low` sensitivity, high statistical confidence is used. Brief violations (for example, due to a surge in load) won't trigger alerts. 

With `high` sensitivity, no statistical confidence is used. Each violation triggers alert.

FailureRateIncreaseThresholdConfig.description:
Fixed thresholds for failure rate increase detection. 

 Required if **detectionMode** is `DETECT_USING_FIXED_THRESHOLDS`. Not applicable otherwise.

loadThreshold.description:

 Response time degradation of services with smaller load won't trigger alerts.

Parameters of the response time degradation auto-detection. Required if the **detectionMode** is `DETECT_AUTOMATICALLY`. Not applicable otherwise. 

Violation of **any** criterion triggers an alert.

filterType.description:
Defines the actual set of fields depending on the value. See one of the following objects: 

* `ENTITY_ID` -> EntityIdAlertingScope 
* `MANAGEMENT_ZONE` -> ManagementZoneAlertingScope 
* `TAG` -> TagFilterAlertingScope 
* `NAME` -> NameAlertingScope 
* `CUSTOM_DEVICE_GROUP_NAME` -> CustomDeviceGroupNameAlertingScope 
* `HOST_GROUP_NAME` -> HostGroupNameAlertingScope 
* `HOST_NAME` -> HostNameAlertingScope 
* `PROCESS_GROUP_ID` -> ProcessGroupIdAlertingScope 
* `PROCESS_GROUP_NAME` -> ProcessGroupNameAlertingScope

MetricEventAutoAdaptiveBaselineMonitorin.description: An auto-adaptive baseline strategy to detect anomalies within metrics that show a regular change over time, as the baseline is also updated automatically. An example is to detect an anomaly in the number of received network packets or within the number of user actions over time.

samples.description: The number of one-minute samples that form the sliding evaluation window.

violatingSamples.description: The number of one-minute samples within the evaluation window that must violate the threshold to trigger an event.

dealertingSamples.description: The number of one-minute samples within the evaluation window that must go back to normal to close the event.

alertCondition.description: The condition for the **threshold** value check: above or below.

alertingOnMissingData.description: If true, also one-minute samples without data are counted as violating samples.

numberOfSignalFluctuations.description: Defines the factor of how many signal fluctuations are valid. Values above the baseline plus the signal fluctuation times the number of tolerated signal fluctuations are alerted.

filterType.description:

method.description:
How to monitor the availability of the process group: 

* `PROCESS_IMPACT`: Alert if any process of the group becomes unavailable. 
* `MINIMUM_THRESHOLD`: Alert if the number of active processes in the group falls below the specified threshold. 
* `OFF`: Availability monitoring is disabled.

type.description:
An action to be taken by the processing: 

* `SUBSTRING`: Extracts the string between **patternBefore** and **patternAfter**. 
* `REPLACEMENT`: Replaces the string between **patternBefore** and **patternAfter** with the specified **replacement**.
* `REPLACE_WITH_PATTERN`: Replaces the **patternToReplace** with the specified **replacement**. 
* `EXTRACT_BY_REGULAR_EXPRESSION`: Extracts the part of the string that matches the **regularExpression**. 
* `REPLACE_WITH_REGULAR_EXPRESSION`: Replaces all occurrences that match **regularExpression** with the specified **replacement**. 
* `REPLACE_IDS`: Replaces all IDs and UUIDs with the specified **replacement**.

patternBefore.description: The pattern before the required value. It will be removed.

patternAfter.description: The pattern after the required value. It will be removed.

patternToReplace.description:
The pattern to be replaced. 

 Only applicable if the **type** is `REPLACE_WITH_PATTERN`.

regularExpression.description:
A regular expression for the string to be extracted or replaced. 

 Only applicable if the **type** is `EXTRACT_BY_REGULAR_EXPRESSION` or `REPLACE_WITH_REGULAR_EXPRESSION`.

fallbackToInput.description:
If set to true: Returns the input if **patternBefore** or **patternAfter** cannot be found and the **type** is `SUBSTRING`. 

 Returns the input if **regularExpression** doesn't match and **type** is `EXTRACT_BY_REGULAR_EXPRESSION`. 

 Otherwise null is returned.

useOrConditions.description: If set to `true` the conditions will be connected by logical OR instead of logical AND.

speedIndexVisuallyCompleteRatioThreshold.description: Warn if Speed index exceeds *X* % of Visually complete.

WaterfallSettings.description: These settings influence the monitoring data you receive for 3rd party, CDN, and 1st party resources.

identifier.description: Dynatrace entity ID of the web application.

name.description: The name of the web application, displayed in the UI.

type.description: The type of the web application.

loadActionKeyPerformanceMetric.description: The key performance metric of load actions.

xhrActionKeyPerformanceMetric.description: The key performance metric of XHR actions.

userActionAndSessionProperties.description: User action and session properties settings. Empty List means no change

metaDataCaptureSettings.description: Java script agent meta data capture settings.

conversionGoals.description: A list of conversion goals of the application.

urlInjectionPattern.description: Url injection pattern for manual web application.

browserVersion.description: The version of the browser that is used.

browserType.description: The type of the browser that is used.

platform.description: The platform on which the browser is being used.

WebApplicationConfigBrowserRestriction.description: Browser exclusion rules for the browsers that are to be excluded.

mode.description: The mode of the list of browser restrictions.

WebApplicationConfigBrowserRestrictionSe.description: Settings for restricting certain browser type, version, platform and, comparator. It also restricts the mode.

mode.description: The mode of the list of ip address restrictions.

WebApplicationConfigIpAddressRestriction.description: Settings for restricting certain ip addresses and for introducing subnet mask. It also restricts the mode.

ignoreJavaScriptErrorsInApdexCalculation.description: Exclude (`true`) or include (`false`) JavaScript errors in Apdex calculation.

ignoreHttpErrorsInApdexCalculation.description: Exclude (`true`) or include (`false`) HTTP errors listed in **httpErrorRules** in Apdex calculation.

ignoreCustomErrorsInApdexCalculation.description: Exclude (`true`) or include (`false`) custom errors listed in **customErrorRules** in Apdex calculation.

httpErrorRules.description:
An ordered list of HTTP errors.

 Rules are evaluated from top to bottom; the first matching rule applies.

customErrorRules.description:
An ordered list of custom errors.

 Rules are evaluated from top to bottom; the first matching rule applies.

ApplicationErrorRules.description: Configuration of error rules in the web application.

keyPattern.description: The key of the error to look for.

valuePattern.description: The value of the error to look for.

impactApdex.description: Include (`true`) or exclude (`false`) the error in Apdex calculation.

customAlerting.description: Include (`true`) or exclude (`false`) the error in Davis AI [problem detection and analysis](https://dt-url.net/a963kd2).

CustomErrorRule.description: Configuration of the custom error in the web application.

considerUnknownErrorCode.description: If `true`, match by errors that have unknown HTTP status code.

considerBlockedRequests.description: If `true`, match by errors that have CSP Rule violations.

errorCodes.description:
The HTTP status code or status code range to match by. 

This field is required if **considerUnknownErrorCode** AND **considerBlockedRequests** are both set to `false`.

filter.description: The matching rule for the URL.

impactApdex.description: Include (`true`) or exclude (`false`) the error in Apdex calculation.

considerForAi.description: Include (`true`) or exclude (`false`) the error in Davis AI [problem detection and analysis](https://dt-url.net/a963kd2).

HttpErrorRule.description: Configuration of the HTTP error in the web application.

identifier.description: Dynatrace entity ID of the web application.

dataCaptureOptInEnabled.description: Set to `true` to disable data capture and cookies until JavaScriptAPI `dtrum.enable()` is called.

persistentCookieForUserTracking.description: Set to `true` to set persistent cookie in order to recognize returning devices.

doNotTrackBehaviour.description:
How to handle the "Do Not Track" header: 

* `IGNORE_DO_NOT_TRACK`: ignore the header and capture the data. 
* `CAPTURE_ANONYMIZED`: capture the data but do not tie it to the user. 
* `DO_NOT_CAPTURE`: respect the header and do not capture.

ApplicationDataPrivacy.description: Data privacy settings of the application.

maskingRuleType.description: The type of the masking rule.

selector.description:
The selector for the element or the attribute to be masked. 

Specify a CSS expression for an element or a [regular expression](https://dt-url.net/k9e0iaq) for an attribute.

userInteractionHidden.description: Interactions with the element are (`true`) or are not (`false) masked.

MaskingRule.description: The masking rule defining how data is hidden.

recordingMaskingSettingsVersion.description:
The version of the content masking. 

You can use this API only with the version 2. 

If you're using version 1, set this field to `2` in the PUT request to switch to version 2.

SessionReplayContentMaskingSettings.description:
Content masking settings for Session Replay. 

For more details, see [Configure Session Replay](https://dt-url.net/0m03slq) in Dynatrace Documentation.

optInModeEnabled.description: If `true`, session recording is disabled until JavaScriptAPI `dtrum.enableSessionReplay()` is called.

urlExclusionRules.description: A list of URLs to be excluded from recording.

SessionReplayDataPrivacySettings.description: Data privacy settings for Session Replay.

maskingPreset.description:
The type of the masking: 

* `MASK_ALL`: Mask all texts, user input, and images. 
* `MASK_USER_INPUT`: Mask all data that is provided through user input 
* `ALLOW_LIST`: Only elements, specified in **maskingRules** are shown, everything else is masked. 
* `BLOCK_LIST`: Elements, specified in **maskingRules** are masked, everything else is shown.

SessionReplayMaskingSetting.description: Configuration of the Session Replay masking.

KeyUserActionList.description: The list of key user actions in the web application

id.description: The ID of the rule.

order.description:
The order of the rule in the rules list. 

The rules are evaluated from top to bottom. The first matching rule applies.

applicationIdentifier.description:
The Dynatrace entity ID of the application, for example `APPLICATION-4A3B43`. 

 You must use an existing ID. If you need to create a rule for an application that doesn't exist yet, [create an application first](https://dt-url.net/vt03khh) and then configure detection rules for it.

name.description: The unique name of the Application detection rule.

applicationMatchTarget.description: Where to look for the the **pattern** value.

ApplicationFilter.description: The condition of an application detection rule.

currentConfigurationVersions.description: A sorted list of version numbers of the configuration.

configurationVersions.description: A sorted list of the version numbers of the configuration.

hostDetectionHeaders.description:
An ordered list of host detection headers. 

Headers are evaluated from top to bottom; the first matching header applies.

operator.description:
Operator of the comparison. You can reverse it by setting **negate** to `true`. 

Possible values depend on the **type** of the comparison. Find the list of actual models in the description of the **type** field and check the description of the model you need.

id.description: The ID of the auto-tag.

name.description:
The name of the auto-tag, which is applied to entities. 

Additionally you can specify a **valueFormat** in the tag rule. In that case the tag is used in the `name:valueFormat` format. 

For example you can extend the `Infrastructure` tag to `Infrastructure:Windows` and `Infrastructure:Linux`.

rules.description:
The list of rules for tag usage. 

When there are multiple rules, the OR logic applies.

entitySelectorBasedRules.description:
A list of entity-selector based rules for auto tagging usage.

If several rules are specified, the **OR** logic applies.

AutoTag.description: Configuration of an auto-tag. It defines the conditions of tag usage and the tag value.

type.description: Type of entities to which the rule applies.

enabled.description: Tag rule is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

propagationTypes.description:
How to apply the tag to underlying entities: 

* `SERVICE_TO_PROCESS_GROUP_LIKE`: Apply to underlying process groups of matching services. 
* `SERVICE_TO_HOST_LIKE`: Apply to underlying hosts of matching services. 
* `PROCESS_GROUP_TO_HOST`: Apply to underlying hosts of matching process groups. 
* `PROCESS_GROUP_TO_SERVICE`: Apply to all services provided by the process groups. 
* `HOST_TO_PROCESS_GROUP_INSTANCE`: Apply to processes running on matching hosts. 
*  `AZURE_TO_PG`: Apply to process groups connected to matching Azure entities. 
* `AZURE_TO_SERVICE`: Apply to services provided by matching Azure entities.

type.description:

* `INDEXED_STRING` -> IndexedStringComparison 
* `INTEGER` -> IntegerComparison 
* `SERVICE_TYPE` -> ServiceTypeComparison 
* `PAAS_TYPE` -> PaasTypeComparison 
* `CLOUD_TYPE` -> CloudTypeComparison 
* `AZURE_SKU` -> AzureSkuComparision 
* `AZURE_COMPUTE_MODE` -> AzureComputeModeComparison 
* `ENTITY_ID` -> EntityIdComparison 
* `SIMPLE_TECH` -> SimpleTechComparison 
* `SIMPLE_HOST_TECH` -> SimpleHostTechComparison 
* `SERVICE_TOPOLOGY` -> ServiceTopologyComparison 
* `DATABASE_TOPOLOGY` -> DatabaseTopologyComparison 
* `OS_TYPE` -> OsTypeComparison 
* `HYPERVISOR_TYPE` -> HypervisorTypeComparision 
* `IP_ADDRESS` -> IpAddressComparison 
* `OS_ARCHITECTURE` -> OsArchitectureComparison 
* `BITNESS` -> BitnessComparision 
* `APPLICATION_TYPE` -> ApplicationTypeComparison 
* `MOBILE_PLATFORM` -> MobilePlatformComparison 
* `CUSTOM_APPLICATION_TYPE` -> CustomApplicationTypeComparison

* `TAG` -> TagComparison 
* `INDEXED_TAG` -> IndexedTagComparison

 Custom tags use the `CONTEXTLESS` value.

key.description:
The key of the tag. 

 Custom tags have the tag value here.

value.description:
The value of the tag. 

 Not applicable to custom tags.

setting.description:
The auto-update state of OneAgents connecting to the environment: 

* `ENABLED`: OneAgents automatically update to the most recent version. 
* `DISABLED`: OneAgents update to the version specified in the **version** field.

OneAgents that connect to the environment use this configuration only when their **setting** parameter is set to `INHERITED`.

version.description:
The version to which the OneAgent must be updated. 

Specify the version in the `<major>.<minor>.<revision>` format (for example `1.181.0`) or `<major>.<minor>` format (for example `1.181`). You can fetch the list of available versions with the [GET available versions](https://dt-url.net/fo23rb5) call. If no suitable installer is found for the provided version or the value is set to `null`, OneAgent won't be updated. 

Only applicable when the **setting** parameter is set to `DISABLED`.

EnvironmentAutoUpdateConfig.description:
Environment-wide configuration of OneAgents auto-updates. 

Applies to all OneAgents connecting to the environment if their **setting** parameter is set to `INHERITED`. Otherwise, the host group or host level setting applies.

name.description: The name of maintenance window

id.description: Identifier of maintenance window

UpdateWindow.description: Basic information about one maintenance window

windows.description: List of maintenance windows when the OneAgent update can start. If there is no value and update should be performed, the update will start at earliest convenience.

UpdateWindowsConfig.description: Basic information about all configured maintenance windows

allowedBeaconOrigins.description: A list of allowed beacon origins for CORS requests.

rejectBeaconsWithoutOriginHeader.description:
Discard (`true`) or keep (`false`) beacons without the **Origin** HTTP header on the BeaconForwarder. 

If not set, `false` is used.

AllowedBeaconOrigins.description: Configuration of the allowed beacon origins for CORS requests.

domainNamePattern.description: The pattern of the allowed domain name.

BeaconDomainPattern.description: Allowed beacon origin for CORS requests.

Typically this is managed by Dynatrace internally and will not be present in GET responses.

Set to `true` for custom messaging services.

The PHP file containing the class or methods to instrument. 

Required for PHP custom service. 

 Not applicable to Java and .NET.

className.description:
The fully qualified class or interface to instrument. 

Required for Java and .NET custom services. 

 Not applicable to PHP.

matcher.description: Matcher applying to the class name. `STARTS_WITH` can only be used if there is at least one annotation defined. Default value is `EQUALS`.

annotations.description:
Additional annotations filter of the rule. 

Only classes where all listed annotations are available in the class itself or any of its superclasses are instrumented. 

Not applicable to PHP.

modifiers.description: The modifiers of the method rule.

additionalProperties.description:
A list of URLs for anonymous access to the dashboard. 

Each link grants access to data from the specific management zone, listed in the in the **managementZoneIds** list. 

These links are automatically generated by Dynatrace, you can't change them.

urls.description:
A list of URLs for anonymous access to the dashboard. 

Each link grants access to data from the specific management zone, listed in the in the **managementZoneIds** list. 

These links are automatically generated by Dynatrace, you can't change them.

managementZoneIds.description:
A list of management zones that can display data on the publicly shared dashboard. 

Specify management zone IDs here. For each management zone you specify Dynatrace generates an access link. You can access them in the **urls** list. 

To share the dashboard with its default management zone, use the `default` value.

id.description: The Dynatrace entity ID of the host where OneAgent is deployed.

setting.description:
The auto-update state of OneAgents on the host: 

* `ENABLED`: OneAgent automatically updates to the most recent version. 
* `DISABLED`: OneAgent updates to the version specified in the **version** field.
* `INHERITED`: The setting from the host group (if the host is a member of a host group) or the environment-wide configuration (if the host doesn't belong to a host group) is used.

version.description:
The version to which the OneAgent must be updated. 

Specify the version in the `<major>.<minor>.<revision>.<timestamp>` format (for example `1.191.0.20200326-161115`). You can fetch the list of available versions with the [GET available versions](https://dt-url.net/fo23rb5) call. 

If no suitable installer is found for the provided version or the value is set to `null`, OneAgent won't be updated. 

Only applicable when the **effectiveSetting** value is `DISABLED`. 

If the **setting** parameter is set to `INHERITED` but the **version** is still set, it will result in a one-time update: OneAgent will be updated to the specified version and the **version** value will be set to `null`. For further updates the parent setting will be used.

effectiveSetting.description:
The actual state of the auto-update on the host. 

Applicable only if the **setting** parameter is set to `INHERITED`. In that case the value is taken from the host group or the environment-wide configuration.

effectiveVersion.description:
The actual version to which the OneAgent must be updated. 

Applicable only if the **setting** parameter is set to `INHERITED` and the **version** parameter is set to `null`. In that case the value is taken from the host group or the environment-wide configuration.

ExceptionPattern.description:
A list of faulty exceptions. 

If an exception on *any* node of the service matches *any* of these patterns it is considered a failure.

id.description: The ID of the parameter set.

The display name of the FDP set. 

The length of the name is limited to 150 characters.

clientSideMissingHttpCodeIsFailure.description:
The missing HTTP response code on the client side is a failure (`true`) or a success (`false`).

 If not set, `false` is used.

serverSideMissingHttpCodeIsFailure.description:
The missing HTTP response code on the server side is a failure (`true`) or a success (`false`).

 If not set, `false` is used.

failingHttpCodesClientSide.description:
A list of client side HTTP response codes that are considered a failure. 

The format is a list of ranges and individual values (for example, `500-599, 400-499, 1008`). 

If not set, the range of `400-599` is used.

failingHttpCodesServerSide.description:
A list of server side HTTP response codes that are considered a failure. 

The format is a list of ranges and individual values (for example, `500-599, 400-499, 1008`).If not set, the range of `500-599` is used.

http404NotFoundFailureEnabled.description:
Special handling of the 404 HTTP response code is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`). See **brokenLinkDomains** for special handling details. 

Only applicable when 404 is NOT in the list of failing HTTP response codes and only for the server side.

 If not set, `false` is used.

brokenLinkDomains.description:
A list of domains for the special handling of the 404 HTTP response code. 

If the top domain of the *Referer* is presented in the list OR equals the top domain of the request's host, the 404 code is considered a failure. 

Only applicable when **isHttp404NotFoundFailureEnabled** is set to `true`.

items.description:
A list of domains for the special handling of the 404 HTTP response code. 

If the top domain of the *Referer* is presented in the list OR equals the top domain of the request's host, the 404 code is considered a failure. 

Only applicable when **isHttp404NotFoundFailureEnabled** is set to `true`.

ignoreAllExceptions.description: If set to true all exceptions will be ignored. Which means defined exception patterns will not have any effect.

successForcingExceptionPatterns.description:
A list of success exceptions. 

If an exception on the entry node of the service matches *any* of these patterns it is considered a success.

ignoredExceptionPatterns.description:
A list of ignored exceptions. 

If an exception on the entry node of the service matches *any* of these patterns it is ignored by failure detection.

exceptionOnAnyNodeExceptionPatterns.description:
A list of faulty exceptions. 

If an exception on *any* node of the service matches *any* of these patterns it is considered a failure.

tagConditions.description:
A list of tag-based conditions. 

If *any* condition is fulfilled the request is considered a failure.

ignoreSpanFailureDetection.description: If set to true span failure detection will be ignored.

FailureDetectionParameterSet.description:
A set of failure detection parameters (FDP). 

These parameters define the conditions of failure and success.

 For the rest of the world use [FIPS 10-4 codes](https://dt-url.net/fipscodes) without country prefix.

setting.description:
The auto-update state of OneAgents in a host group: 

* `ENABLED`: OneAgents automatically update to the most recent version. 
* `DISABLED`: OneAgents update to the version specified in the **version** field.
* `INHERITED`: The setting from the environment-wide configuration is used.

OneAgents installed on hosts of the host group use this configuration only when their **setting** parameter is set to `INHERITED`.

version.description:
The version to which the OneAgent must be updated. 

Specify the version in the `<major>.<minor>.<revision>` format (for example `1.181.0`) or `<major>.<minor>` format (for example `1.181`). You can fetch the list of available versions with the [GET available versions](https://dt-url.net/fo23rb5) call. If no suitable installer is found for the provided version or the value is set to `null`, OneAgent won't be updated. 

Only applicable when the **setting** parameter is set to `DISABLED`.

pathDefinitions.description:
A list of filtering criteria for log path. 

If several criteria are specified, the OR logic applies.

sourceEntities.description:
A list of Dynatrace entities, where the log can originate from. Specify Dynatrace entity IDs here. 

 Allowed types of entities are `PROCESS_GROUP` and `PROCESS_GROUP_INSTANCE`. You can't mix entity types. 

If several entities are specified, the OR logic applies. 

This field is mutually exclusive with the **osTypes** field.

hostFilters.description:
A list of hosts, where the log can originate from. Specify Dynatrace entity IDs here. 

If several hosts are specified, the OR logic applies.

osTypes.description:
A list of operating system types, where the log can originate from. 

If set, **only OS logs** are included in the result. 

If several OS are specified, the OR logic applies. 

This field is mutually exclusive with the **sourceEntities** field.

LogSourceFilter.description:
Configuration of the log filter for a custom log metric. 

If several criteria are specified, the AND logic applies.

definition.description:

 Each rule is evaluated independently of all other rules.

propagationTypes.description:
How to apply the management zone to underlying entities: 

* `SERVICE_TO_HOST_LIKE`: Apply to underlying hosts of matching services. 
* `SERVICE_TO_PROCESS_GROUP_LIKE`: Apply to underlying process groups of matching services. 
* `PROCESS_GROUP_TO_HOST`: Apply to underlying hosts of matching process groups. 
* `PROCESS_GROUP_TO_SERVICE`: Apply to all services provided by matching process groups. 
* `HOST_TO_PROCESS_GROUP_INSTANCE`: Apply to processes running on matching hosts. 
* `CUSTOM_DEVICE_GROUP_TO_CUSTOM_DEVICE`: Apply to custom devices in matching custom device groups. 
* `AZURE_TO_PG`: Apply to process groups connected to matching Azure entities. 
* `AZURE_TO_SERVICE`: Apply to services provided by matching Azure entities.

Each rule is evaluated independently of all other rules.

value.description:
The value of the tag. Not applicable to custom tags. 

If a tag does have a separate key and value (in the textual representation they are split by the colon :), this field is set with the actual value. Key-value pairs can occur for automatically imported tags and tags set by rules if extractors are used.

key.description:
The key of the tag. For custom tags, put the tag value here.

The key allows categorization of multiple tags. It is possible that there are multiple values for a single key which will all be represented as standalone tags. Therefore, the key does not have the semantic of a map key but is more like a key of a key-value tuple. In some cases, for example custom tags, the key represents the actual tag value and the value field is not set  those are called valueless tags.

context.description:
The origin of the tag, such as AWS or Cloud Foundry. For custom tags use the `CONTEXTLESS` value. 

The context is set for tags that are automatically imported by OneAgent (for example, from the AWS console or environment variables). Its useful for determining the origin of tags when not manually defined, and it also helps to prevent clashes with other existing tags. If the tag is not automatically imported, `CONTEXTLESS` set.

UniversalTag.description: Use only request attributes from services that have this tag. Use either this or `managementZone`

customMessage.description:
The custom message of the notification. 

 This message will be displayed in the extra variables **Message** field of your job template.

 You can use the following placeholders: 
* `{ImpactedEntities}`: Details about the entities impacted by the problem in form of a JSON array. 
* `{ImpactedEntity}`: The entity impacted by the problem or *X* impacted entities. 
* `{PID}`: The ID of the reported problem. 
* `{ProblemDetailsText}`: All problem event details, including root cause, as a text-formatted string.

name.description: The name of the plugin, displayed in Dynatrace.

version.description: The version of the plugin, displayed in Dynatrace.

type.description: The type of the plugin. It indicates the runtime environment of the plugin (for example, ActiveGate).

metricGroup.description: The metric group of the plugin. All the metrics, captured by the plugin are children of this group.

type.description: The type of the property.

defaultValue.description: The default value of the property.

dropdownValues.description:
The list of possible values of the property. 

 If such a list is defined, only values from this list can be assigned to the property.

version.description: The version of the plugin (for example `1.0.0`).

endpointId.description: The ID of the endpoint where the state is detected - Active Gate only.

stateDescription.description: A short description of the state.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the state was detected, in UTC milliseconds.

hostId.description: The ID of the host on which the plugin runs.

processId.description: The ID of the entity on which the plugin is active.

networkScope.description:
The network scope of the remote environment:
* `EXTERNAL`: The remote environment is located in an another network. 
* `INTERNAL`: The remote environment is located in the same network. 
* `CLUSTER`: The remote environment is located in the same cluster. 

Dynatrace SaaS can only use `EXTERNAL`.

If not set, `EXTERNAL` is used.

uri.description: The display name of the remote environment.

RemoteEnvironmentConfigStub.description: The short representation of a remote environment.

networkScope.description:
The network scope of the remote environment:
* `EXTERNAL`: The remote environment is located in an another network. 
* `INTERNAL`: The remote environment is located in the same network. 
* `CLUSTER`: The remote environment is located in the same cluster. 

Dynatrace SaaS can only use `EXTERNAL`.

If not set, `EXTERNAL` is used.

displayName.description: The display name of the remote environment.

id.description: The ID of the configuration.

token.description:
The API token granting access to the remote environment. 

The token must have the **Fetch data from a remote environment** (`RestRequestForwarding`) scope. 

For security reasons, GET requests return this field as `null`.

uri.description: The URI of the remote environment.

id.description: The ID of the report.

dashboardId.description: The ID of the associated dashboard.

enabled.description: The email notifications for the dashboard report are enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

DashboardReport.description:
Configuration of a dashboard report. 

The dashboard report provides a public link to the associated dashboard with a custom reporting period: last week for weekly subscribers or last month for monthly subscribers.

WEEK.description:
A list of weekly subscribers. 

Weekly subscribers receive the report every Monday at midnight. 

 You can specify email addresses or Dynatrace user IDs here.

MONTH.description:
A list of monthly subscribers. 

Monthly subscribers receive the report on the first Monday of the month at midnight. 

You can specify email addresses or Dynatrace user IDs here.

DashboardReportSubscription.description: A list of the report subscribers.

id.description: The ID of the report.

type.description: The type of the report.

dashboardId.description: The ID of the associated dashboard.

DashboardReportStub.description: A short representations of the report.

values.description: A list of reports.

ReportStubList.description: A list of short representations of reports.

schedule.description:
The schedule of the subscription. 

 * Weekly subscribers receive the report every Monday at midnight. 
 * Monthly subscribers receive the report on the first Monday of the month at midnight.

recipients.description:
A list of the recipients. 

You can specify email addresses or Dynatrace user IDs here.

capture.description: What to capture from the method.

argumentIndex.description:
The index of the argument to capture. Set `0` to capture the return value, `1` or higher to capture a mehtod argument. 

 Required if the **capture** is set to `ARGUMENT`.

 Not applicable in other cases.

deepObjectAccess.description:
The getter chain to apply to the captured object. It is required in one of the following cases:

 The **capture** is set to `THIS`. 
  The **capture** is set to `ARGUMENT`, and the argument is not a primitive, a primitive wrapper class, a string, or an array. 

 Not applicable in other cases.

enabled.description: The data source is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

source.description: The source of the attribute to capture. Works in conjunction with **parameterName** or **methods** and **technology**.

technology.description: The technology of the method to capture if the **source** value is `METHOD_PARAM`. \n\n Not applicable in other cases.

sessionAttributeTechnology.description: The technology of the session attribute to capture if the **source** value is `SESSION_ATTRIBUTE`. \n\n Not applicable in other cases.

serverVariableTechnology.description: The technology of the server variable to capture if the **source** value is `SERVER_VARIABLE`. \n\n Not applicable in other cases.

methods.description:
The method specification if the **source** value is `METHOD_PARAM`. 

 Not applicable in other cases.

parameterName.description:
The name of the web request parameter to capture.

 Required if the **source** is one of the following: `POST_PARAMETER`, `GET_PARAMETER`, `REQUEST_HEADER`, `RESPONSE_HEADER`, `CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE`.

 Not applicable in other cases.

capturingAndStorageLocation.description:
Specifies the location where the values are captured and stored.

 Required if the **source** is one of the following: `GET_PARAMETER`, `URI`, `REQUEST_HEADER`, `RESPONSE_HEADER`. 

 Not applicable in other cases. 

 If the **source** value is `REQUEST_HEADER` or `RESPONSE_HEADER`, the `CAPTURE_AND_STORE_ON_BOTH` location is not allowed.

iibNodeType.description:
The IBM integration bus node type for which the value is captured.

 This or `iibMethodNodeCondition` is required if the **source** is: `IIB_NODE`.

 Not applicable in other cases.

spanAttributeKey.description:
The key of the span attribute to capture.

 Required if the **source** is: `SPAN_ATTRIBUTE`.

 Not applicable in other cases.

cicsTransactionCallType.description:
CICS transaction call type condition for which the value is captured.

 Required if the **source** is: `CICS_TRANSACTION_CALL_TYPE`.

 Not applicable in other cases.

imsTransactionCallType.description:
IMS transaction call type condition for which the value is captured.

 Required if the **source** is: `IMS_TRANSACTION_CALL_TYPE`.

 Not applicable in other cases.

position.description: The position of the extracted string relative to delimiters.

endDelimiter.description:
The end-delimiter string. 

 Required if the **position** value is `BETWEEN`. Otherwise not allowed.

ExtractSubstring.description: Preprocess by extracting a substring from the original value.

visibility.description: The visibility of the method to capture.

modifiers.description: The modifiers of the method to capture.

className.description:
The class name where the method to capture resides. 

 Either this or the **fileName** must be set.

fileName.description:
The file name where the method to capture resides. 

 Either this or **className** must be set.

fileNameMatcher.description:
The operator of the comparison. 

 If not set, `EQUALS` is used.

methodName.description: The name of the method to capture.

MethodReference.description: Configuration of a method to be captured.

id.description: The ID of the request attribute.

name.description: The name of the request attribute.

enabled.description: The request attribute is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

dataType.description: The data type of the request attribute.

normalization.description:
String values transformation. 

 If the **dataType** is not `string`, set the `Original` here.

aggregation.description: Aggregation type for the request values.

confidential.description: Confidential data flag. Set `true` to treat the captured data as confidential.

skipPersonalDataMasking.description:
Personal data masking flag. Set `true` to skip masking. 

 Warning: This will potentially access personalized data.

serviceTechnology.description: Only applies to this service technology.

processGroup.description: Only applies to this process group. Note that this can't be transferred between different clusters or environments.

hostGroup.description: Only applies to this host group.

tagOfProcessGroup.description: Only apply to process groups matching this tag.

operator.description: Operator comparing the extracted value to the comparison value.

ValueCondition.description: IBM integration bus label node name condition for which the value is captured.

valueExtractorRegex.description: Extract value from captured data per regex.

splitAt.description: Split (preprocessed) string values at this separator.

id.description: The ID of the request naming rule.

order.description:
The order string. Sorting request namings alphabetically by their order string determines their relative ordering.

Typically this is managed by Dynatrace internally and will not be present in GET responses nor used if present in PUT/POST requests, except where noted otherwise.

enabled.description: The rule is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

namingPattern.description: The name to be assigned to matching requests.

managementZones.description: Specifies the management zones for which this rule should be applied.

conditions.description:
The set of conditions for the request naming rule usage. 

 You can specify several conditions. The request has to match **all** the specified conditions for the rule to trigger.

placeholders.description:
The list of custom placeholders to be used in the naming pattern. 

 It enables you to extract a request attribute value or other request attribute and use it in the request naming pattern.

image.description: The list of image extensions that will be renamed to `Image`.

binary.description: The list of binary extensions that will be renamed to `Binary`.

AfterTransformation.description: The transformation of the `AFTER` type.The transformation removes everything before the specified delimiter and keeps the value after it.

delimiter.description:
The delimiter of the transformation. The transformation removes everything before this delimiter and keeps everything after it.  

 The delimiter itself is not kept. 

 If several delimiters appear in the initial value, only the first one is used.

transformations.description: Transformations to be applied to the detected value.

valueOverride.description: The value to be used instead of the detected value.

ApplicationId.description:
The contribution to the service ID calculation from the detected application ID. 

 You have two mutually exclusive options: 
* Override the detected value with a specified static value. Specify the new value in the **valueOverride** field. 
* Dynamically transform the detected value. Specify the transformation parameters in the **transformations** field.

BeforeTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `BEFORE` type. 

The transformation keeps the value before the specified delimiter and removes everything after it.

delimiter.description:
The delimiter of the transformation. The transformation keeps everything before this delimiter and removes everything after it. 

 The delimiter itself is not kept. 

If several delimiters appear in the initial value, only the first one is used.

BetweenTransformation.description: The transformation of the `BETWEEN` type.The transformation keeps value between the specified delimiters and removes everything outside them.

after.description: The starting delimiter. The transformation removes everything before it. The delimiter itself is not kept.

before.description: The ending delimiter. The transformation removes everything after it. The delimiter itself is not kept.

type.description:
Defines the actual set of fields depending on the value. See one of the following objects: 

* `EQUALS` -> EqualsCompareOperation 
* `STRING_CONTAINS` -> StringContainsCompareOperation 
* `STARTS_WITH` -> StartsWithCompareOperation 
* `ENDS_WITH` -> EndsWithCompareOperation 
* `EXISTS` -> ExistsCompareOperation 
* `IP_IN_RANGE` -> IpInRangeCompareOperation 
* `LESS_THAN` -> LessThanCompareOperation 
* `GREATER_THAN` -> GreaterThanCompareOperation 
* `INT_EQUALS` -> IntEqualsCompareOperation 
* `STRING_EQUALS` -> StringEqualsCompareOperation 
* `TAG` -> TagCompareOperation

CompareOperation.description:
The condition of the rule. 

The actual set of fields depends on the type of the condition. Find the list of actual objects in the description of the **type** field or see [Service detection API - JSON models](https://dt-url.net/2ie3slq).

attributeType.description: The type of the attribute to be checked.

compareOperations.description:
A list of conditions for the rule. 

If several conditions are specified, the AND logic applies.

ConditionsFullWebRequestAttributeTypeDto.description: A condition of the service detection rule.

transformations.description: Transformations to be applied to the detected value.

segmentsToCopyFromUrlPath.description:
The number of segments of the URL to be kept. 

The URL is divided by slashes (`/`), the indexing starts with 1 at context root. 

For example, if you specify `2` for the `www.dynatrace.com/support/help/dynatrace-api/` URL, the value of `support/help` is used.

ContextRoot.description:
The contribution to the service ID calculation from the detected context root. 

 The context root is the first segment of the request URL after server name. For example, in the `www.dynatrace.com/support/help/dynatrace-api/` URL the context root is `support`. 

You have two options: 
* Keep a part of the detected URL. Specify the number of segments to be kept in the **segmentsToCopyFromUrlPath** field. 
* Dynamically transform the detected URL. Specify the transformation parameters in the **transformations** field. 

You can use one or both options. If you use both, the transformation applies to the modified URL.

type.description:
Defines the actual set of fields depending on the value. See one of the following objects: 

* `BEFORE` -> BeforeTransformation 
* `REPLACE_BETWEEN` -> ReplaceBetweenTransformation 
* `REMOVE_NUMBERS` -> RemoveNumbersTransformation 
* `REMOVE_CREDIT_CARDS` -> RemoveCreditCardNumbersTransformation 
* `REMOVE_IBANS` -> RemoveIBANsTransformation 
* `REMOVE_IPS` -> RemoveIPsTransformation

ContextRootTransformation.description:
Configuration of transformation of the detected value. 

If several transformations are specified, they are handled sequentially from top to bottom. Each transformation is applied to the result of the preceding transformation. For example, the second transformation is applied to the result of the first transformation. 

The actual set of fields depends on the `type` of the transformation.

EndsWithCompareOperation.description:
The condition of the `ENDS_WITH` type. 

The condition checks whether the string value ends with the specified text.

negate.description:
Inverts the operation of the condition. Set to `true` to turn **ends with** into **does not end with**. 

 If not set, then `false` is used.

ignoreCase.description:
The condition is case sensitive (`false`) or case insensitive (`true`). 

If not set, then `false` is used, making the condition case sensitive.

values.description:
The value to compare to. 

If several values are specified, the OR logic applies.

EqualsCompareOperation.description:
The condition of the `EQUALS` type. 

The condition checks whether the detected value equals the specified one.

negate.description:
Inverts the operation of the condition. Set to `true` to turn **equals** into **does not equal**. 

 If not set, then `false` is used.

ignoreCase.description:
The condition is case sensitive (`false`) or case insensitive (`true`). 

If not set, then `false` is used, making the condition case sensitive.

values.description:
The value to compare to. 

If several values are specified, the OR logic applies.

ExistsCompareOperation.description:
The condition of the `EXISTS` type. 

The condition checks whether the specified attribute exists.

negate.description:
Inverts the operation of the condition. Set to `true` to turn **exists** into **does not exist**. 

 If not set, then `false` is used.

 You can specify only 1 management zone here.

IntEqualsCompareOperation.description:
The condition of the `INT_EQUALS` type. 

The condition checks whether the integer value equals the specified value.

negate.description:
Inverts the operation of the condition. Set to `true` to turn **equals** into **does not equal**. 

 If not set, then `false` is used.

values.description:
The value to compare to. 

If several values are specified, the OR logic applies.

IpInRangeCompareOperation.description:
The condition of the `IP_IN_RANGE` type. 

The condition checks whether the IP address belongs to a specified range.

negate.description:
Inverts the operation of the condition. Set to `true` to turn **IP is in range** into **IP is not in range**. 

 If not set, then `false` is used.

lower.description: The lower boundary of the IP range.

upper.description: The upper boundary of the IP range.

LessThanCompareOperation.description:
The condition of the `LESS_THAN` type. 

The condition checks whether the integer value is less than the specified value.

RemoveCreditCardNumbersTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `REMOVE_CREDIT_CARDS` type. 

The transformation automatically detects and removes credit card numbers. No additional parameters needed.

RemoveIBANsTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `REMOVE_IBANS` type. 

The transformation automatically detects and removes International Bank Account Numbers (IBAN). No additional parameters needed.

RemoveIPsTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `REMOVE_IPS` type. 

The transformation automatically detects and removes IP addresses. No additional parameters needed.

RemoveNumbersTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `REMOVE_NUMBERS` type. 

The transformation removes any numbers from the detected value.

minDigitCount.description: Remove numbers that contain at least *X* digits.

includeHexNumbers.description:
Remove (`true`) or keep (`false`) hexadecimal numbers. 

 If not set, then `false` is used, keeping hexadecimal numbers.

ReplaceBetweenTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `REPLACE_BETWEEN` type. 

The transformation replaces the content in between specified delimiters with the specified value. The rest of the string remains intact.

after.description: The starting delimiter. The transformation replaces everything from here until ending delimiter. The delimiter itself remain intact.

before.description: The ending delimiter. The transformation replaces everything from starting delimiter until here. The delimiter itself remain intact.

replacement.description: The value to be used instead of the content between delimiters.

transformations.description: Transformations to be applied to the detected value.

valueOverride.description: The value to be used instead of the detected value.

ServerName.description:

 You have two mutually exclusive options: 
* Override the detected value with a specified static value. Specify the new value in the **valueOverride** field. 
* Dynamically transform the detected value. Specify the transformation parameters in the **transformations** field.

SplitSelectTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `SPLIT_SELECT` type. 

The transformation splits the detected value into an array and keeps the specified element of the array.

delimiter.description: The delimiter for splitting the detected value. The delimiter itself is not kept.

itemIndex.description: The index of the element in the split array to be used. Indexing starts with `1`.

StartsWithCompareOperation.description:
The condition of the `STARTS_WITH` type. 

The condition checks whether the string value starts with the specified text.

negate.description:

 If not set, then `false` is used.

ignoreCase.description:
The condition is case sensitive (`false`) or case insensitive (`true`). 

If not set, then `false` is used, making the condition case sensitive.

values.description:

If several values are specified, the OR logic applies.

negate.description:

 If not set, then `false` is used.

ignoreCase.description:

If not set, then `false` is used, making the condition case sensitive.

values.description:

StringEqualsCompareOperation.description:

negate.description:

 If not set, then `false` is used.

values.description:

TagCompareOperation.description:

The condition checks if the process group of the potential service is tagged with a specific tag.

compareKeyOnly.description:
If `true` ignores the tag values and only validates that the tag key is matching.
Defaults to `false`.

tags.description:
The value to compare to. 

If several values are specified, the OR logic applies.

TakeSegmentsTransformation.description:
The transformation of the `TAKE_SEGMENTS` type. 

The transformation splits the detected value into an array and keeps the specified number of first or last elements.

segmentCount.description: The number of elements to be kept.

delimiter.description: The delimiter for splitting the detected value. The delimiter itself is not kept.

takeFromEnd.description:
Keeps the first (`false`) or last (`true`) elements. 

 If not set, then `false` is used, keeping the first elements.

Detect the matching requests as full web services (`false`) or web request services (`true`). 

Setting this field to `true` prevents detecting of matching requests as full web services. A web request service is created instead. If you need to further modify the resulting web request service, you need to create a separate rule of the `FULL_WEB_REQUEST` type. 

Default is `false`, detecting matching requests as full web services.

 * `HESSIAN` 
 * `JAX_WS_RI` 
 * `JBOSS` 
 * `JERSEY` 
 * `PROGRESS` 
 * `RESTEASY` 
 * `RESTLET` 
 * `SPRING` 
 * `TIBCO` 
 * `WEBLOGIC` 
 * `WEBMETHODS` 
 * `WEBSPHERE` 
 * `WINK`

FASTCHECK_NO_RESPONSE: The endpoint did not return a result until the timeout was reached.

ASSIGNED: The credentials are assigned to an ActiveGate which is responsible for processing.
UNASSIGNED: The credentials are not yet assigned to an ActiveGate so there is currently no processing.
DISABLED: The credentials have been disabled by the user.
FASTCHECK_AUTH_ERROR: The credentials are invalid.
FASTCHECK_TLS_ERROR: The endpoint TLS certificate is invalid.
FASTCHECK_NO_RESPONSE: The endpoint did not return a result until the timeout was reached.
FASTCHECK_INVALID_ENDPOINT: The endpoint URL was invalid.
FASTCHECK_AUTH_LOCKED: The credentials seem to be locked.
UNKNOWN: An unknown error occured.

endpointStatusInfo.description: The detailed status info of the configured endpoint.

label.description:
The name of the Kubernetes credentials configuration. 

Allowed characters are letters, numbers, whitespaces, and the following characters: `.+-_`. Leading or trailing whitespace is not allowed.

endpointUrl.description:
The URL of the Kubernetes API server. 

It must be unique within a Dynatrace environment. 

The URL must valid according to RFC 2396. Leading or trailing whitespaces are not allowed.

authToken.description:
The service account bearer token for the Kubernetes API server. 

Submit your token on creation or update of the configuration. For security reasons, GET requests return this field as `null`. 

If the field is omitted during an update, the old value remains unaffected.

activeGateGroup.description: Active Gate group to filter active gates for this credentials.

eventsIntegrationEnabled.description:
The monitoring of events is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`) for the Kubernetes cluster. Event monitoring depends on the active state of this configuration to be true. 

If not set on creation, the `false` value is used. 

If the field is omitted during an update, the old value remains unaffected.

eventAnalysisAndAlertingEnabled.description:
[Deprecated] With 1.240 the EA events monitoring has been deprecated and replaced by the events GA version which obsoletes this property.

Corresponds to the value of `eventsIntegrationEnabled`.



 The field is ignored during an update, the old value remains unaffected.

workloadIntegrationEnabled.description: Workload and cloud application processing is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`) for the Kubernetes cluster. If the field is omitted during an update, the old value remains unaffected.

prometheusExportersIntegrationEnabled.description: Prometheus exporters integration is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`) for the Kubernetes cluster. If the field is omitted during an update, the old value remains unaffected.

davisEventsIntegrationEnabled.description: Inclusion of all Davis relevant events is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`) for the Kubernetes cluster. If the field is omitted during an update, the old value remains unaffected.

eventsFieldSelectors.description: Kubernetes event filters based on field-selectors. If set to `null` on creation, no events field selectors are subscribed. If set to `null` on update, no change of stored events field selectors is applied. Set an empty list to clear all events field selectors.

certificateCheckEnabled.description:
The check of SSL certificates is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`) for the Kubernetes cluster. 

If not set on creation, the `true` value is used. 

If the field is omitted during an update, the old value remains unaffected.

label.description: A label of the events field selector.

fieldSelector.description: The field selector string (url decoding is applied) when storing it.

active.description: Whether subscription to this events field selector is enabled (value set to `true`). If disabled (value set to `false`), Dynatrace will stop fetching events from the Kubernetes API for this events field selector

KubernetesEventPattern.description: Represents a single Kubernetes events field selector (=event filter based on the K8s field selector).

id.description: The ID of the Dynatrace entity.

name.description: The name of the Dynatrace entity.

description.description: A short description of the Dynatrace entity.

endpointUrl.description:
The URL of the Kubernetes API server. 

It must be unique within a Dynatrace environment. 

The URL must valid according to RFC 2396. Leading or trailing whitespaces are not allowed.

KubernetesConfigShortRepresentation.description: The short representation of a kubernetes configuration.

id.description: The ID of the maintenance window.

name.description: The name of the maintenance window, displayed in the UI.

description.description: A short description of the maintenance purpose.

type.description: The type of the maintenance: planned or unplanned.

suppression.description: The type of suppression of alerting and problem detection during the maintenance.

suppressSyntheticMonitorsExecution.description: Suppress execution of synthetic monitors during the maintenance.

type.description: The type of the Dynatrace entities (for example, hosts or services) you want to pick up by matching.

mzId.description: The ID of a management zone to which the matched entities must belong.

tags.description:
The tag you want to use for matching. 

You can use custom tags from the UI, AWS tags, Cloud Foundry tags, OpenShift/Kubernetes, and tags based on environment variables.

tagCombination.description:
The logic that applies when several tags are specified: AND/OR. 

If not set, the OR logic is used.

MonitoredEntityFilter.description: A matching rule for Dynatrace entities.

dayOfWeek.description:
The day of the week for weekly maintenance. 

The format is the full name of the day in upper case, for example `THURSDAY`.

dayOfMonth.description:
The day of the month for monthly maintenance. 

The value of `31` is treated as the last day of the month for months that don't have a 31st day.
The value of `30` is also treated as the last day of the month for February.

startTime.description: The start time of the maintenance window in HH:mm format.

durationMinutes.description: The duration of the maintenance window in minutes.

Recurrence.description: The recurrence of the maintenance window.

recurrenceType.description: The type of the schedule recurrence.

start.description: The start date and time of the maintenance window validity period in yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm format.

end.description: The end date and time of the maintenance window validity period in yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm format.

zoneId.description:
The time zone of the start and end time. Default time zone is UTC. 

You can use either UTC offset `UTC+01:00` format or the IANA Time Zone Database format (for example, `Europe/Vienna`).

Schedule.description: The schedule of the maintenance window.

entities.description:
A list of Dynatrace entities (for example, hosts or services) to be included in the scope. 

Allowed values are Dynatrace entity IDs.

matches.description:
A list of matching rules for dynamic scope formation. 

If several rules are set, the OR logic applies.

Scope.description:
The scope of the maintenance window. 

 The scope restricts the alert/problem detection suppression to certain Dynatrace entities. It can contain a list of entities and/or matching rules for dynamic formation of the scope. 

 If no scope is specified, the alert/problem detection suppression applies to the entire environment.

Api-Token.description:
Dynatrace API Token

 The token is passed in the **Authorization** header in the following format: `Authorization: Api-Token abcdefjhij1234567890`.
Api-Token.name: Authorization
